ygData.subject: RE: Gargoyle Island in OOT
ygData.msgSnippet: It all depends on the number of resists I get with the DDD.  If one or two I m ok, but three or more and I will have to run.  I hit selo s for a burst of speed
ygData.messageBody:
It all depends on the number of resists I get with the DDD. If one or two
I'm ok, but three or more and I will have to run. I hit selo's for a burst
of speed then slow down until the garg is in bellows range, then twist
bellows and heal. Then turn and melee when I'm healed enough.

Tomerrilin

-----Original Message-----
From: Joshua R. Moore [mailto:josh@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 17, 2000 11:26 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Gargoyle Island in OOT


From: "Joshua R. Moore" <josh@...>

I soloed Gargoyles at level 23 With very few mishaps. I twisted COD, DDD,
and Hymn. at 25 I found I killed the gargoyles faster with weapons (shrug)
Silvery war axe and Black enameled mace.
I never had to kite the Gargoyles, but I did run from them once, when I got
4 of them

-----Original Message-----
From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:jht@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 17, 2000 11:13 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Gargoyle Island in OOT


From: John Tatsukawa <jht@...>

> -----Original Message-----
> From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 16, 2000 11:40 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Gargoyle Island in OOT
>
>
> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Wed, 16 Feb 2000, Peck White wrote:
> >
> > meantime I started using Bellow on the first garg. I found
> that with Selo's
> > I was moving too fast to stay in range and let Selo's drop.
> It turns out
> > that gargs fly at the same speed that we run, so I just
> kept up a normal run
> > and bellowed until garg number one bit the dust. I then
> started in on garg
>
> You have become better at kiting (107)
>
> :)
>
> I think the question was whether you could do it solo without
> kiting. Clearly you couldn't once you got 2 gargs on you.

At level 23 I almost always had to kite at the end when soloing gargs, even
with just instruments. Maybe this was because I was just in banded/bronze at
the time, not much else in the way of armor upgrades. For me, it wasn't
until 25 where I could handle single gargs with little trepidation.

Oh, as a courtesy, I usually tried to leave 1 garg on the island before I
logged off if nobody else was around, since the gargs kill the skeletons.

Also, nice to melee a gargoyle who is fighting a skeleton as the skeleton
will keep hitting the gargoyle. Just make sure you kill the skeleton before
killing the gargoyle to ensure the skeleton doesn't get credited with
killing the gargoyle. :-)

---Windleaf
